member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.AdminViewer.Skin_Single_AdminViewer
member.summary: Class allows an authenticated aggregation admin to edit information related to a single item aggregation.
member.remarks:
This class extends the class.
MySobek Viewers are used for registration and authentication with mySobek, as well as performing any task which requires authentication, such as online submittal, metadata editing, and system administrative tasks.
During a valid html request, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the Application_State_Builder
Request is analyzed by the QueryString_Analyzer and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in his case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. Since this action requires authentication, an instance of the class is created.
The mySobek subwriter creates an instance of this viewer to view and edit information related to a single item aggregation

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.AggregationViewer.Viewers.abstractAggregationViewer
member.summary: Abstract class which all collection viewer classes extend
member.remarks:
This class implements the interface.
Collection viewers are used when displaying collection home pages, searches, browses, and information pages.
During a valid html request, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the Application_State_Builder
Request is analyzed by the QueryString_Analyzer and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in his case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. For a collection-level request, an instance of the class is created.
To display the requested collection view, the collection subwriter will create one or more collection viewers ( implementing this class )

To display the requested collection view, the collection subwriter will create one or more collection viewers ( implementing this class )

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.AggregationViewer.Viewers.Advanced_Search_MimeType_AggregationViewer
member.summary: Renders the advanced search page for a given item aggregation
member.remarks:
This class implements the interface and extends the class.
Aggregation viewers are used when displaying aggregation home pages, searches, browses, and information pages.
During a valid html request to display the advanced search page, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the Application_State_Builder
Request is analyzed by the QueryString_Analyzer and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in this case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. For a collection-level request, an instance of the class is created.
To display the requested collection view, the collection subwriter will creates an instance of this class

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.HTML.Admin_HtmlSubwriter
member.summary: Adminl subwriter is used for administrative tasks, either collection admin, portal admin, or system admin
member.remarks:
This class extends the abstract class.
During a valid html request, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the Application_State_Builder
Request is analyzed by the QueryString_Analyzer and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in his case the
The HTML writer will create this necessary subwriter since this action requires administrative rights.
This class will create a admin subwriter (extending ) for the specified task.The admin subwriter creates an instance of this viewer to view and edit existing item aggregationPermissions in this digital library

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.ItemViewer.Viewers.iItemViewerPrototyper
member.summary: Interface for the item viewer prototyper, which is used for all viewer functions (such as writing the menu HTML, determining inclusion in an item, determining access, etc..) NOT included in the item viewer. Objects that implement this interface also generate the item viewer
member.remarks: This prototyper is generally reserved and works as a singleton, so no individual digital resource or request-specific data should be saved in classes that implement this interface.

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.AdminViewer.Aggregation_Single_AdminViewer
member.summary: Class allows an authenticated aggregation admin to edit information related to a single item aggregation.
member.remarks:
This class extends the class.
MySobek Viewers are used for registration and authentication with mySobek, as well as performing any task which requires authentication, such as online submittal, metadata editing, and system administrative tasks.
During a valid html request, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the Application_State_Builder
Request is analyzed by the QueryString_Analyzer and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in his case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. Since this action requires authentication, an instance of the class is created.
The mySobek subwriter creates an instance of this viewer to view and edit information related to a single item aggregation

member.summary: Gets the flag that indicates if the page selector should be shown

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.ItemViewer.Viewers.MultiVolumes_ItemViewer.PageCount
member.summary: Gets the number of pages for this viewer
member.value: This is generally single page viewer, so this property usually returns the value 1. If there are over 100 volumes and it is currently in thumbnail view, then it will return a value so that 60 volumes appear on each page.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.ItemViewer.Viewers.MultiVolumes_ItemViewer.Current_Page
member.summary: Gets the current page for paging purposes
member.value: This returns either 1, or the value from the current reqeust mode

member.summary: Gets the url to go to the first page
member.remarks: This only returns a value when the view mode is set to thumbnail and there are over 100 volumes associated with the title

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.ItemViewer.Viewers.MultiVolumes_ItemViewer.Previous_Page_URL
member.summary: Gets the url to go to the previous page

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Localization.Classes.Aggregation_Single_AdminViewer_LocalizationInfo.TheInformationInThisSectionControlsHowSearc
member.remarks: '"The information in this section controls how search results or item browses appears. The facet options control which metadata values appear to the left of the results, to allow users to narrow their results. The search results values determine which options are available for viewing the results and what are the aggregation defaults. Finally, the result fields determines which values are displayed with each individual result in the result set."' localization string

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Localization.Classes.Aggregation_Single_AdminViewer_LocalizationInfo.TheInformationInThisSectionIsTheBasicInfor
member.remarks: '"The information in this section is the basic information about the aggregation, such as the full name, the shortened name used for breadcrumbs, the description, and the email contact. "' localization string

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Localization.Classes.Aggregation_Single_AdminViewer_LocalizationInfo.TheMetadataBrowsesCanBeUsedToExposeAllThe
member.remarks: 'The metadata browses can be used to expose all the metadata of the resources within this aggregation for public browsing. Select the metadata fields you would like have available below.' localization string

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Localization.Classes.Aggregation_Single_AdminViewer_LocalizationInfo.TheValuesInThisSectionDetermineIfTheCollec
member.remarks: '"The values in this section determine if the collection is currently visible at all, whether it is eligible to appear on the collection list at the bottom of the parent page, and the collection button used in that case. Thematic headings are used to place this collection on the main home page."' localization string

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Localization.Classes.Aggregation_Single_AdminViewer_LocalizationInfo.TheseOptionsControlHowSearchingWorksWithinT
member.remarks: '"These options control how searching works within this aggregation, such as which search options are made publicly available."' localization string

member.remarks: '"These three settings have the most profound affects on the appearance of this aggregation, by forcing it to appear under a particular web skin, allowing a custom aggregation-level stylesheet, or completely overriding the system-generated home page for a custom home page HTML source file."' localization string

member.remarks: '"For definitions of these terms, see the definitions on the main statistics page."' localization string

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Localization.Classes.Citation_ItemViewer_LocalizationInfo.TheDataOrMetadataAboutThisDigitalResourceI
member.remarks: '"The data (or metadata) about this digital resource is available in a variety of metadata formats. For more information about these formats, see the a href=http://ufdc.ufl.edu/sobekcm/metadata"">Metadata Section(/a) of the (a href=""http://ufdc.ufl.edu/sobekcm/"")Technical Aspects(/a) information."' localization string

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Localization.Classes.Citation_ItemViewer_LocalizationInfo.ThisMetadataFileIsTheSourceMetadataFileSub
member.remarks: '"This metadata file is the source metadata file submitted along with all the digital resource files. This contains all of the citation and processing information used to build this resource. This file follows the established (a href=""http://www.loc.gov/standards/mets/"")Metadata Encoding and Transmission Standard(/a) (METS) and (a href=""http://www.loc.gov/standards/mods/"")Metadata Object Description Schema(/a) (MODS). This METS/MODS file was just read when this item was loaded into memory and used to display all the information in the standard view and marc view within the citation."' localization string

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Localization.Classes.Citation_ItemViewer_LocalizationInfo.TheEnteredMetadataIsAlsoConvertedToMARCXML
member.remarks: '"The entered metadata is also converted to MARC XML format, for interoperability with other library catalog systems. This represents the same data available in the (a href=""%1"")MARC VIEW(/a) except this is a static XML file. This file follows the (a href=""http://www.loc.gov/standards/marcxml/"")MarcXML Schema(/a)."' localization string

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Localization.Classes.Citation_ItemViewer_LocalizationInfo.TheFulltextOfThisItemIsAlsoAvailableInThe
member.remarks: '"The full-text of this item is also available in the established standard (a href=""http://www.tei-c.org/index.xml"")Text Encoding Initiative(/a) (TEI) downloadable file."' localization string

member.remarks: 'The record above was auto-generated from the METS file.' localization string

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.MySobekViewer.Edit_Item_Permissions_MySobekViewer
member.summary: Viewer allows permissions on an item to be modified by logged on administrative users

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.MySobekViewer.abstract_MySobekViewer
member.summary: Abstract class which all mySobek viewer classes extend
member.remarks:
MySobek Viewers are used for registration and authentication with mySobek, as well as performing any task which requires authentication, such as online submittal, metadata editing, and system administrative tasks.
During a valid html request, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the Application_State_Builder
Request is analyzed by the QueryString_Analyzer and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in his case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. If the action requires authentication, an instance of the class is created.
To allow the requested action, the mySobek subwriter will create one of the mySobek viewers( implementing this class )

member.summary: If a user attempts to upload a disallowed file extension, this is the message that will be popped up to the user
member.remarks: You can use '<extension>' in the string to have the extension of the attempted file in your message. Setting this to an empty string will cause no alert to happen clientside, but the upload will be cancelled.
member.value: Default value is 'File types of '<extension>' are not allowed'

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.RevertToFlashVersion
member.summary: Flag indicates that if the client does not have HTML5 with their browser, to revert to the Flash version, if it is available
member.value: Default value is FALSE

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.RevertedButtonClass
member.summary: If this is set, this class will be used for the button when the HTML5 version has reverted to the flash version.
member.value: Can be useful to see if it reverts

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.NoHtml5OrFlashMessage
member.summary: Message displayed if the user has neither HTML5 on their browse nor Flash installed
member.value: Default value is 'Your browse must either be HTML5-compliant or have Adobe Flash installed to use this upload feature'.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.ServerSideFileName
member.summary: Name for the final server-side file, which allows overriding the default name, which would otherwise match the uploaded name
member.remarks: This can be used to avoid having to manually rename the file after upload

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.ReturnToken
member.summary: Return token is used to pass back the information about which file(s) were uploaded

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.Auto
member.summary: If set to true, files will automatically upload when added to the queue
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is TRUE

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.ButtonClass
member.summary: A class name to add to the UploadiFive button DOM element

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.ButtonText
member.summary: The text to display inside the browse button
member.remarks: This text is rendered as HTML and may contain tags or HTML entities.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.CheckScript
member.summary: The path to the server-side files that checks whether a files with the same name as that being uploaded exists in the destination folder
member.remarks: If the file does not exist, this script should return 0. If the files does exist, the script should return 1.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.DragAndDrop
member.summary: If set to false, drag and drop capabilities will not be enabled
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is TRUE

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.FileObjName
member.summary: The name of the file object to use in your server-side script
member.remarks: For example, in PHP, if this option is set to ‘the_files’, you can access the files that have been uploaded using $_FILES['the_files'];
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 'Filedata'

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.FileSizeLimit
member.summary: The maximum upload size allowed in KB
member.remarks: This option also accepts a unit. If using a unit, the value must begin with a number and end in either KB, MB, or GB. Set this option to 0 for no limit.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.FileType
member.summary: The type of files allowed for upload
member.remarks: This is taken from the file’s mime type. To allow all images, set this option to ‘image’. To allow a specific type of image, set this option to ‘image/png’. To allow all files, set this value to false. This option will also accept a JSON array to allow a specific set of fileTypes.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 'false'

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.FormData
member.summary: Additional data to send to the server-side upload script
member.remarks: Data sent via this option will be sent via the headers and can be accessed via the $_POST array (if using the ‘post’ method). So if you send something like {‘someKey’ : ‘someValue’}, then you can access it as $_POST['someKey'].

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.ButtonHeight
member.summary: The height of the browse button in pixels
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 30

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.ItemTemplate
member.summary: The itemTemplate option allows you to specify a special HTML template for each item that is added to the queue
member.value: The outtermost item element MUST have the class “uploadifive-queue-item” as the code uses this class to perform various tasks. See instructions on main Uploadify site for more information.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.Method
member.summary: The type of method to use when submitting the form
member.remarks: If set to ’get’, the formData values are sent via the querystring. If set to ‘post’, the fromData values are sent via the headers.
member.value: Default value is POST

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.Multi
member.summary: Whether or not to allow multiple file selection in the browse dialog window
member.remarks: Setting to true will allow multiple file selection. This does not affect the amount of files that can be added tot he queue. To limit the queue size to 1, use the QueueSizeLimit option.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is TRUE

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.QueueID
member.summary: The ID of the element you want to use as a file queue
member.remarks: This element will also act as the drop target for files if DragAndDrop (dnd) is set to true. If the value is set to false, a queue will be created and an ID will be assigned to it.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 'false;

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.QueueSizeLimit
member.summary: The maximum number of files you can have in the queue at one time
member.remarks: This does not affect the amount of files that may be uploaded. To set the amount of files you may upload, use the uploadLimit option. Set to 0 to set the limit to unlimited.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 0

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.RemoveCompleted
member.summary: Whether or not to remove items that have completed uploading from the queue
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is FALSE

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.Swf
member.summary: This is the location of the uploadify.swf file, including the name of the script

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.SimUploadLimit
member.summary: The number of files that can be simultaneously uploaded at any given time
member.remarks: Set to 0 to remove the limit.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.TruncateLength
member.summary: The number of characters at which to truncate the file name in the queue
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 0

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.UploadLimit
member.summary: The maximum number of files that may be uploaded
member.remarks: Set to 0 to remove any limit. This does not affect the number of files that may be added to the queue. For that, use the QueueSizeLimit option.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 0

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.UploadScript
member.summary: The path to the script that will process the uploaded file
member.remarks: To use the provided ASP.net classes/helpers, do NOT set this directly. For the FLASH version, this actually maps to the 'uploader' value.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.ButtonWidth
member.summary: The width of the browse button in pixels
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 100

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFiveControl.RevertedButtonClass
member.summary: If this is set, this class will be used for the button when the HTML5 version has reverted to the flash version.
member.value: Can be useful to see if it reverts

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFiveControl.NoHtml5OrFlashMessage
member.summary: Message displayed if the user has neither HTML5 on their browse nor Flash installed
member.value: Default value is 'Your browse must either be HTML5-compliant or have Adobe Flash installed to use this upload feature'.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFiveControl.ServerSideFileName
member.summary: Name for the final server-side file, which allows overriding the default name, which would otherwise match the uploaded name
member.remarks: This can be used to avoid having to manually rename the file after upload

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFiveControl.ReturnToken
member.summary: Return token is used to pass back the information about which file(s) were uploaded

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFiveControl.Auto
member.summary: If set to true, files will automatically upload when added to the queue
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is TRUE

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFiveControl.ButtonClass
member.summary: A class name to add to the UploadiFive button DOM element

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFiveControl.ButtonText
member.summary: The text to display inside the browse button
member.remarks: This text is rendered as HTML and may contain tags or HTML entities.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFiveControl.CheckScript
member.summary: The path to the server-side files that checks whether a files with the same name as that being uploaded exists in the destination folder
member.remarks: If the file does not exist, this script should return 0. If the files does exist, the script should return 1.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFiveControl.DragAndDrop
member.summary: If set to false, drag and drop capabilities will not be enabled
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is TRUE

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFiveControl.FileObjName
member.summary: The name of the file object to use in your server-side script
member.remarks: For example, in PHP, if this option is set to ‘the_files’, you can access the files that have been uploaded using $_FILES['the_files'];
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 'Filedata'

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFiveControl.FileSizeLimit
member.summary: The maximum upload size allowed in KB
member.remarks: This option also accepts a unit. If using a unit, the value must begin with a number and end in either KB, MB, or GB. Set this option to 0 for no limit.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFiveControl.FileType
member.summary: The type of files allowed for upload
member.remarks: This is taken from the file’s mime type. To allow all images, set this option to ‘image’. To allow a specific type of image, set this option to ‘image/png’. To allow all files, set this value to false. This option will also accept a JSON array to allow a specific set of fileTypes.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 'false'

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFiveControl.FormData
member.summary: Additional data to send to the server-side upload script
member.remarks: Data sent via this option will be sent via the headers and can be accessed via the $_POST array (if using the ‘post’ method). So if you send something like {‘someKey’ : ‘someValue’}, then you can access it as $_POST['someKey'].

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFiveControl.ButtonHeight
member.summary: The height of the browse button in pixels
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 30

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFiveControl.ItemTemplate
member.summary: The itemTemplate option allows you to specify a special HTML template for each item that is added to the queue
member.value: The outtermost item element MUST have the class “uploadifive-queue-item” as the code uses this class to perform various tasks. See instructions on main Uploadify site for more information.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFiveControl.Method
member.summary: The type of method to use when submitting the form
member.remarks: If set to ’get’, the formData values are sent via the querystring. If set to ‘post’, the fromData values are sent via the headers.
member.value: Default value is POST

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFiveControl.Multi
member.summary: Whether or not to allow multiple file selection in the browse dialog window
member.remarks: Setting to true will allow multiple file selection. This does not affect the amount of files that can be added tot he queue. To limit the queue size to 1, use the QueueSizeLimit option.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is TRUE

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFiveControl.QueueID
member.summary: The ID of the element you want to use as a file queue
member.remarks: This element will also act as the drop target for files if DragAndDrop (dnd) is set to true. If the value is set to false, a queue will be created and an ID will be assigned to it.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 'false;

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFiveControl.QueueSizeLimit
member.summary: The maximum number of files you can have in the queue at one time
member.remarks: This does not affect the amount of files that may be uploaded. To set the amount of files you may upload, use the uploadLimit option. Set to 0 to set the limit to unlimited.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 0

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFiveControl.RemoveCompleted
member.summary: Whether or not to remove items that have completed uploading from the queue
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is FALSE

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFiveControl.SimUploadLimit
member.summary: The number of files that can be simultaneously uploaded at any given time
member.remarks: Set to 0 to remove the limit.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFiveControl.Swf
member.summary: This is the location of the uploadify.swf file, including the name of the script

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFiveControl.TruncateLength
member.summary: The number of characters at which to truncate the file name in the queue
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 0

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFiveControl.UploadLimit
member.summary: The maximum number of files that may be uploaded
member.remarks: Set to 0 to remove any limit. This does not affect the number of files that may be added to the queue. For that, use the QueueSizeLimit option.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 0

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFiveControl.UploadScript
member.summary: The path to the script that will process the uploaded file
member.remarks: To use the provided ASP.net classes/helpers, do NOT set this directly

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Helpers.UploadiFive.UploadiFiveControl.ButtonWidth
member.summary: The width of the browse button in pixels
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 100

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.AggregationViewer.Viewers.Item_Count_AggregationViewer
member.summary: Renders the item count information for a single aggregation
member.remarks:
This class implements the interface and extends the class.
Aggregation viewers are used when displaying aggregation home pages, searches, browses, and information pages.
During a valid html request to display the item count information, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the Application_State_Builder
Request is analyzed by the QueryString_Analyzer and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in this case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. For a collection-level request, an instance of the class is created.
To display the requested collection view, the collection subwriter will creates an instance of this class

member.summary: Constructor for a new instance of the Item_Count_AggregationViewer class
member.param: All the necessary, non-global data specific to the current request
Aggregation-specific request information, such as aggregation object and any browse object requested

member.remarks:
This class implements the interface and extends the class.
Aggregation viewers are used when displaying aggregation home pages, searches, browses, and information pages.
During a valid html request to display the usage statistics page, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the Application_State_Builder
Request is analyzed by the QueryString_Analyzer and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in this case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. For a collection-level request, an instance of the class is created.
To display the requested collection view, the collection subwriter will creates an instance of this class

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.AdminViewer.Settings_AdminViewer
member.summary: Class allows an authenticated system admin to view and edit the library-wide system settings in this library
member.remarks:
This class extends the class.
MySobek Viewers are used for registration and authentication with mySobek, as well as performing any task which requires authentication, such as online submittal, metadata editing, and system administrative tasks.
During a valid html request, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the Application_State_Builder
Request is analyzed by the QueryString_Analyzer and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in his case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. Since this action requires authentication, an instance of the class is created.
The mySobek subwriter creates an instance of this viewer to show the library-wide system settings in this digital library

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.AdminViewer.Home_AdminViewer
member.summary: Class allows a system admin to view the administrative home page, with all their options in a menu
member.remarks:
This class extends the class.
MySobek Viewers are used for registration and authentication with mySobek, as well as performing any task which requires authentication, such as online submittal, metadata editing, and system administrative tasks.
During a valid html request, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the Application_State_Builder
Request is analyzed by the QueryString_Analyzer and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in his case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. Since this action requires authentication, an instance of the class is created.
The mySobek subwriter creates an instance of this viewer to display the system admin home page

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.MySobekViewer.Mass_Update_Items_MySobekViewer
member.summary: Class allows an authenticated user to change the behaviors for all the items within a single title
member.remarks:
This class extends the class.
MySobek Viewers are used for registration and authentication with mySobek, as well as performing any task which requires authentication, such as online submittal, metadata editing, and system administrative tasks.
During a valid html request, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the Application_State_Builder
Request is analyzed by the QueryString_Analyzer and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in his case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. Since this action requires authentication, an instance of the class is created.
The mySobek subwriter creates an instance of this viewer to display the behaviors for mass updating
This viewer uses the class to display the correct elements for editing

This class implements the interface and extends the class.

During a valid html request to display the advanced search page, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the Application_State_Builder
Request is analyzed by the QueryString_Analyzer and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in this case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. For a collection-level request, an instance of the class is created.
To display the requested collection view, the collection subwriter will creates an instance of this class

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.HTML.MySobek_HtmlSubwriter
member.summary: My Sobek html subwriter is used for registration and authentication with mySobek, as well as performing any task which requires authentication, such as online submittal, metadata editing, and system administrative tasks
member.remarks:
This class extends the abstract class.
During a valid html request, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the Application_State_Builder
Request is analyzed by the QueryString_Analyzer and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in his case the
The HTML writer will create this necessary subwriter since this action requires authentication.
This class will create a mySobek subwriter (extending ) for the specified task.The mySobek subwriter creates an instance of this viewer to view and edit existing item aggregationPermissions in this digital library

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.MySobekViewer.Edit_Item_Metadata_MySobekViewer
member.summary: Class allows an authenticated RequestSpecificValues.Current_User to edit a digital resource online, using various possible templates
member.remarks:
This class extends the class.
MySobek Viewers are used for registration and authentication with mySobek, as well as performing any task which requires authentication, such as online submittal, metadata editing, and system administrative tasks.
During a valid html request, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the Application_State_Builder
Request is analyzed by the QueryString_Analyzer and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in his case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. Since this action requires authentication, an instance of the class is created.
The mySobek subwriter creates an instance of this viewer to display the item for editing
This viewer uses the class to display the correct elements for editing

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.MySobekViewer.Preferences_MySobekViewer
member.summary: Class allows an unauthenticated user to register and an authenticated user to change their preferences
member.remarks:
This class extends the class.
MySobek Viewers are used for registration and authentication with mySobek, as well as performing any task which requires authentication, such as online submittal, metadata editing, and system administrative tasks.
During a valid html request, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the Application_State_Builder
Request is analyzed by the QueryString_Analyzer and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in his case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. Since this action requires authentication, an instance of the class is created.
The mySobek subwriter creates an instance of this viewer for either registering or changing their preferences
